series.title: Call of Cthulhu RPG
series.description: Call of Cthulhu is a tabletop role-playing game inspired by the fiction of H.P. Lovecraft.
series.note:
This is not the place for Call of Cthulhu fiction, nor is it the place for H.P. Lovecraft's story "The Call of Cthulhu."
    
    This series is as close as I could get to chronological order, but there may be inaccuracies. If you have better information, rearrange at will.
    
    As each book can only be added to a series once, books with multiple editions or printings are placed in the series when the first edition or printing was published, even if Goodreads does not have that edition in its database.
    
    Good resources for this series include:
    http://www.yog-sothoth.com/wiki/index.php/Main_Page
    http://index.rpg.net/
    And, of course, the web sites of the various publishers, including first and foremost http://www.chaosium.com/
    
    Still to do:
    Resolve the issue with Dreamlands. There are 5 editions (actual editions, not counting different printings) Starting with 4th Edition, a different person was listed as primary author. So the different editions span two books. They should be merged, if possible. Additionally, one of the 5th edition books has two entries, one under each set of editions.

    This series is as close as I could get to chronological order, but there may be inaccuracies. If you have better information, rearrange at will.
    
    As each book can only be added to a series once, books with multiple editions or printings are placed in the series when the first edition or printing was published, even if Goodreads does not have that edition in its database.
    
    Good resources for this series include:
    http://www.yog-sothoth.com/wiki/index.php/Main_Page
    http://index.rpg.net/
    And, of course, the web sites of the various publishers, including first and foremost http://www.chaosium.com/
    
    Still to do:
    Resolve the issue with Dreamlands. There are 5 editions (actual editions, not counting different printings) Starting with 4th Edition, a different person was listed as primary author. So the different editions span two books. They should be merged, if possible. Additionally, one of the 5th edition books has two entries, one under each set of editions.
